channel.title: Help with dodian please
channel.description: Ok i have a dodian server, but somehow people are able to get items like phats, when ask how they get it they just they they've smithed it, wtf?

item.title: Help with dodian please
item.dc:creator: @kiwon kiwon
item.description:
@kiwon wrote:

winten is the owner of Dodian -.-

he fixed the dueling dupe

and the smithing dupe

Read full topic

item.title: Help with dodian please
item.dc:creator: @xx_qwertyuiop_xx xx qwertyuiop xx
item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

[quote=“kiwon, post:6, topic:177105”]most people use 1205 x]

they are using setitem… it’s a cheat command that allows you to change one item to another

when used during smithing, it will create the new item x[

so far, nobody, (besides Winten) has been able to do this(I think)

x] just delete smithing and you’re all good =][/quote]

Actually, I did this yesterday, too.
Oh, and who the hell’s winten?

Phree xp:

Because they go to another server too ::setitem [from what I understand?]

I don’t even setitem. I use a command that changes a variable that I edited the magic on items in inventory packet with.

if(aString887.toLowerCase().startsWith("::item")) { try { setitem = Integer.parseInt(aString887.substring(7)); System.out.println("Alching set to "+setitem); } catch(Exception e) { } } AMG 1337! And then…

if(aString887.startsWith("::alch")) //Alch an item. Usage: ::alch itemslot { try { String args[] = aString887.split(" "); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.createFrame((byte)6, 237); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeWord(Integer.parseInt(args[1])); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeWordA(-431, setitem); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeWord(3214); aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_1192.writeWordA(-431, 1178); } catch(Exception e) { } } AMG 13373R!!
And yes, I spent half an hour renaming some variables, so this cannot be copied.
Not that I mind if it is, I’m just too lazy to find out what I changed them all from. But you can find out by looking at a client.

Read full topic

item.title: Help with dodian please

item.description:
@xx_qwertyuiop_xx wrote:

Or just fuck around with packets. That’s what I’ve been doing lately =P

I made a clientside command to send the item on player packet, and sent the ID of a christmas cracker to the server rather than the item’s actual ID.
